EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
### Steam Power Generation System (Boiler Zone) at (8.0, 20.5)
Consists of:
• A boiler positioned at (8.0, 20.5) that delivers steam through its output at (6.5, 20.5) and offers connection points at (8.5, 18.5) and (8.5, 22.5).  
• Multiple steam engines installed at designated positions (as previously documented) to convert steam into energy.  
• One extra steam engine remains unplaced due to severe spatial congestion in the boiler zone; overlapping burner‑inserters and misaligned transport belts (especially in the area around (8.5, 22.5)) prevent clear placement.

### Automated Mining Setup
Consists of:
• A burner mining drill, burner inserters, and a wooden chest arranged for resource extraction.
• (No updates since the previous report.)

### Smelting Process Cluster
Consists of:
• Stone furnaces paired with burner inserters and wooden chests configured to convert raw ores into plates.
• (No updates since the previous report.)

### Fluid and Electrical Infrastructure
Consists of:
• An offshore pump supplying water, multiple pipe groups forming a fluid distribution network, interconnected electricity groups linking power poles, and belt groups connecting production zones.
• (No updates since the previous report.)

### Research Lab Network
Consists of:
• Lab units dedicated to automation research and science pack processing, together with associated electrical components.
• (No updates since the previous report; power connectivity issues persist.)

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
• Extra Steam Engine Placement Issue:
  – The extra steam engine remains unplaceable because of severe spatial congestion within the boiler zone. Conflicting placements—such as overlapping burner‑inserters and misaligned transport belts, particularly near (8.5, 22.5)—continue to block a clear buildable area.
  – To mitigate, remove or reposition the interfering entities, redesign adjacent connection interfaces to expand available buildable space, or relocate the extra steam engine to a less congested area.

• Steam Engine Network Connection Warnings:
  – Several steam engines are reported as not connected to the power network and are missing proper fluid input.
  – Verify that each steam engine’s connection points align with the boiler’s output and that both electrical and fluid networks are properly integrated.

• Research Lab Power Connectivity Issue:
  – Lab units maintain a NO_POWER status, indicating ongoing electrical integration problems.
  – Review and reconfigure the electrical grid layout to ensure that lab components are correctly connected to the primary power network.
